page.title: 03Farming in Llangunllo
page.content: Farming Dominates this area. Over seventy-five percent of the population depend upon it for their livelihood. Adverse physical factors, e.g. poor soils, steep slopes, climate, confine agricultural activity in the area to the production of livestock. Small family farms are engaged in the raising of 'stores', both sheep and cattle. Sheep are the most important enterprise. Store lambs are reared for subsequent fattening by the lowland farmers. However, in recent years "fat lamb production" has increased within the area. Breeding ewes are forwarded in the autumn, although this custom is dying out. Large numbers of store cattle are sold in October and November by which means the farmers of the area reduce their stock for the winter. Crop cultivation mainly grass is for fodder.
